result.execSummary:
The defendant Cha Vang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.
  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.
  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE to obtain and maintain FT employment and/or school and if not must complete 20 hours community service per week.

Counseling
DNA sample w/ surcharge.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: With huber for school, work, and treatment.

Case called:  2:22 pm
Clerk: Kassidi
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig
Defendant appears in custody and with Atty Sharon Gisselman 
Interpreter Mai Kou Yang sworn and interprets
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to DRI Cts. 2,4, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10 - Court Grants .  
PLEA: NO CONTEST- Cts 1, 3, 5 (Manufacture/Deliver-Amph 2nd sub)
Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  
COURT ORDERS: SWH - 3 years prob. concurrent. CONDITIONS: 9 months jail on each count and concurrent to each other w/ 170 days credit on each count w/ huber privileges with school/work/treatment; Good faith effort to obtain and maintain FT employment and/or school and if not must complete 20 hours of community service per week; Counseling; CC; DNA sample and surcharge
COURT advises defendant and signs an ineligible of voter notice.
